subject: Self Care
title: Kristin Neff's Three Pillars
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Kristin Neff's Three Pillars.

hook.text: You'd comfort a hurting friend in seconds. But when you hurt, you attack yourself. Self-compassion flips that.

buildup.text: Kristin Neff defined self-compassion as three elements: self-kindness, common humanity, and mindfulness.

discovery.text: Self-kindness replaces criticism. Common humanity replaces isolation. Mindfulness replaces over-identification.

twist.text: Self-compassion is not self-pity. Self-pity says 'poor me.' Self-compassion says 'this is hard, and I'm not alone.'

climax.text: Treat yourself like you'd treat a good friend in pain. That simple shift is the foundation of all self-compassion.

punchline.text: Be kind. You're human. Stay present. Three pillars.

quiz.question: What are Kristin Neff's three pillars of self-compassion?
